pull.title: rpc, bugfix: Enforce maximum value for setmocktime
pull.body:
The maximum value for our mocktime must be representable in nanoseconds, otherwise we end up with negative values returned from `NodeClock::now()`.

Found through fuzzing:

```
$ echo "c2V0bW9ja3RpbWVcZTptYf9w/3NldG3///////////////9p////ZP///ymL//////89////Nv9L////////LXkBAABpAA==" | base64 --decode > rpc-8cab9148ab4418ebd1923c213e9d3fe9c9b49b39.crash
$ FUZZ=rpc ./src/test/fuzz/fuzz rpc-8cab9148ab4418ebd1923c213e9d3fe9c9b49b39.crash
fuzz_libfuzzer: util/time.cpp:28: static NodeClock::time_point NodeClock::now(): Assertion `ret > 0s' failed.
```

Could combine the two error messages into one, as both are related to out-of-range?

events.message: [rpc, bugfix] Enforce maximum value for setmocktime

comments.body: nit: could be better to remove this and use `util/time.h` instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ def run_test(self):
         self._test_uptime()
 
     def _test_negative_time(self):
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Mocktime cannot be negative: -1.", self.nodes[0].setmocktime, -1)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Mocktime must be in the range [0, 9223372036], not -1.", self.nodes[0].setmocktime, -1)
comments.body:
Maybe add a
```
assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Mocktime must be in the range [0, 9223372036], not 9223372037.", self.nodes[0].setmocktime, 9223372037)
```
?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ def run_test(self):
         self._test_uptime()
 
     def _test_negative_time(self):
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Mocktime cannot be negative: -1.", self.nodes[0].setmocktime, -1)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Mocktime must be in the range [0, 9223372036], not -1.", self.nodes[0].setmocktime, -1)
comments.body: If you are changing this, it could also make sense to test that a full round trip of the value `9223372036` works.
